column1: length ball, just around off stump, defended from the back foot
a touch fuller and straighter this time, Hope was once again on the back foot, defends it back towards the bowler
on the front foot this time, was fuller and a bit wider, Hope with the full face of the bat but the ball went straight to the mid-off fielder
length ball, on the pads, flicked towards square leg
short of length, Hope rises on his toes to get on the top of it and works it in front of square for a quick single
fuller, just outside off, Hetmyer steers it towards point
length ball, around off, some turn for him straightaway, worked away towards short midwicket
fuller on stumps this time, driven towards long-off
length ball from around the wicket, goes towards the leg side and flicks it with wrists towards the square leg boundary
length ball, comes forward and blocks
flighted outside off, waits for it turn before guiding it towards short third man
flatter and quicker, angling in to the batsman who once again was looking to move away but the ball hurries on to him and hits him on the pads
back of length outside off, punched off the back foot but straight to the man at extra cover
in the corridor, on a length, Hope pushes at it without any feet movement, gets beaten
played on the up, not from the middle of the bat but got enough to take over the infield, a couple of bounces and over the point boundary
length ball, on the pads and flicked away to get to the other end
on the pads and clipped away. The fine leg was inside the circle, the ball flew over him and that's four easy runs for the left-hander
back of length around off, defended solidly on the front foot
length ball, on the pads, worked away towards square leg for a quick single

that could have been close. Hetmyer cuts it hard towards short third man, Khaleel was quick to the ball, to his left side as well, Hope was halfway down but did well to undo his steps, put in a dive as well and it was all safe for West Indies in the end
short and Hetmyer backs away and hammers it straight, between the umpire and the non-striker
length ball outside off, pushed towards short third man, a loud no straightaway this time
fuller outside off and Hetmyer clears his front leg and powers it through extra cover for four more
down the leg side and that's five wides as Hetmyer fails to get bat on the attempted sweep
length ball, flatter this time, rapping the batsman on the pads, a mild appeal but I guess that would have gone down the leg side
starts with a nothing sort of delivery, was short of length, angling in to the batsman, Hope pulls it nicely towards square leg for four, the fine leg was inside the circle
slower one this time, Hope was early into the pull, gets an inside edge onto the body, was looking to steal a single but Bhuvi was quick to the ball
length outside off, stays inside the line of the ball and works it towards point
length outside off, comes down the track and lofts it over mid-off for four more
he's annoyed with himself this time, was backing away, trying to give himself room, but the ball kept coming in with the angle, had to defend in the end
pushed towards mid-on for a quick single, a fumble there by the fielder makes it an easy run in the end
length ball outside off, steered towards point
short of length outside off, Hope was quick to pounce on that, lofts it over long-on for six
and again, almost another six. Dhawan at the fence, catches it before losing his balances, throws it inside just in time
fired in outside off, Hetmyer goes for the cut and misses
much slower this time, short of length and spinning back into the batsman who had to adjust to defend it
another maximum. Hit the skirting on the full and that's 50 for West Indies. It was a full delivery outside off, Hetmyer cleared his front leg and smashed it straight down the ground
and strikes with his first ball. Hope went for another big hit, tried to slog sweep this but ended up top-edging it towards deep midwicket, where Washington settled under it quite nicely
a googly but that turned a mile and has been called a wide
another googly, Hetmyer rocked back and pulled it towards long-on
length, just outside off, a tap and run towards extra cover to get off the mark
short of length, goes back and cuts it towards deep backward point, fielder there
another wrong'un. Was a touch fuller as well, Bravo stays back and defends it on the off side
length outside off, forced off the back foot towards covers for a run
length ball, around off, pushed towards extra cover
flatter and pushed through, Hetmyer works it towards long-on, was a bit early into the shot
slow turn, goes for the cut but finds extra cover
quicker and fuller, cuts it towards cover
fuller on stumps, played with soft hands towards square leg for a quick single
falls short. Was a length ball, around middle and leg, Hetmyer was once again early into his push and almost lobbing it back towards the bowler
short and wide, cuts it away but straight to the man at covers
short and wide and another cut, once again straight to the man at cover
googly, adjust well in the end and opens the face to guide it towards short third man
short and wide, Hetmyer had to reach out for it, a single to deep extra cover
length outside off, played gently towards extra cover for a quick single

and that's the end of Hetmyer's innings. Second wicket for Chahal. It was a quicker delivery, bounced a bit more than the batsman expected, Hetmyer went with the cut but couldn't keep it down, Pandya took an easy catch at deep backward point
length outside off, defended from the crease
paddles it towards fine leg for a single
length ball outside off, dabs it towards short third man for a quick single
fuller on pads, was looking to work it on the leg side, gets a leading edge towards covers
quicker one, aimed at the stumps, gets his bat down in time to work it towards square leg
length ball, on the stumps, backs away and works it towards long-on
fuller and slower, just around off, worked away towards the right of the long-on fielder
wrong'un. On the pads, pushed towards square leg
fuller outside off, lofts it straight down the ground, the ball hit the bottom part of the bat, bounces just inside
fuller on pads, was a googly again, tucked away behind square leg
fuller, around middle and leg, flicked towards midwicket
big turn for Chahal. Pitched on a length outside off, and came back in sharply to cut the batsman in half and beat the wicketkeeper as well
fuller on pads, worked away towards square leg
short and wide, goes for the cut, a misfield there by the point fielder allows the single
length ball on the stumps, goes back and forces it towards long-on
fired outside off this time, Bravo was backing away but that's too wide
fuller, in fact a low full toss outside off, hammered towards long-on
dropped. Slower through the air, length ball on the stumps, Ramdin chips it back, Krunal jumps, gets his hands to it but couldn't latch on. Wasn't a difficult chance by any means
another chip, this time just past the short midwicket, on his left, for a single to long-on
length ball, pitching around middle and leg and spinning further down, Karthik couldn't take it cleanly
length outside off, steered towards short third man
fuller on pads, Ramdin was looking to go big over midwicket, misses and the ball rolls towards fine leg off the pads
down the track and swings it over midwicket this time, with the turn, a 77-metre six
tossed up outside off, Ramdin was looking to go over long-off this time, misses
length ball, around off, goes back and cuts it into the ground
chopped on this time, a similar delivery, maybe a tad quicker this time, Ramdin was once again looking to give himself room and cut it away, ends up chopping it on to the stumps this time
slower and wider, cuts it away towards deep cover
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover-point
slower one, length ball, just outside off, beats the batsmen with the offcutter
and again, another slower one and once again the batsmen getting squared-up
another slower one, and this time Pooran gets an edge on it, Khaleel at short third man moves quickly to his right to keep it to one
that's the fourth slower one in a row, Bravo works it towards square leg
make that five, Pooran flashes hard at it and this time a thick outside edge beats the man at sweeper cover on his right
fired in outside off, the batsman lets it go, called a wide
and again, left alone but perhaps was a but closer to the batsman this time
quicker again, pushed on the off side for a run
cuts it away towards sweeper cover
quicker and fuller outside off, smashed away down the ground, four to long-on
fuller outside off, Bravo goes aerial, a couple of runs to the right of long-off
fuller and much closer to the batsman, gets the timing right this time, Bravo and clears the long-off
short and wide, goes for the cut but fails to connect
length outside off, Pooran pushes at it and gets beaten
short of length and Pooran has pulled it straight, over long-on, what a strike. Was a slower one as well
and again, was fuller and wider outside off and just clears the long-off fielder this time. Back to back sixes for Pooran
fuller, in the blockhole, jammed towards point for a single
slower length ball, on the pads, worked towards vacant short midwicket region, Bhuvi fields himself
once again yorker length, just around off stump, squeezed out towards long-off
was short of length and Pooran unleashes a switch hit and pulls it over square leg for a six
length ball, but down the leg side and spinning further away
and again, even further down, Karthik did well to get to it
short and wide and cuts it away towards sweeper cover for another brace
slower this time, length outside off, goes for the cut but the ball hits the bottom part and dribbles towards short third man
length ball, comes back in sharply, Bravo was looking to go for the cut, gets cramped
short of length outside off, cuts it away towards sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, looks to go big, over extra cover, the ball spins back in to hit the inner half and rolls towards short fine leg
length ball, backs away and pulls it towards square leg, didn't hit it from the middle of the bat
length outside off, Bravo also attempts a pull but misses
a yorker on the leg stump, Bravo cannot do anything about it, gets hit on the pads
a slower one, Bravo goes for the pull, the bottom hands comes off, KL Rahul at deep midwicket makes a good sliding stop to his left
another brilliant yorker, following the batsman as the batsman once again fails to get the bat on the ball, through to the keeper
fuller on the stumps and worked towards the left of long-on
in the blockhole, squeezed out towards long-on
reverse sweep, was a low full toss, just guiding it over short third man, Chahal didn't time his jump well, the ball brushing his hands and going for four
and again, this time on the bounce on to the bat, Chahal does better this time, moves to his left and keeps it to one
fuller down the leg side, Bhuvi got lucky there, only a single to fine leg
once again full on the pads, clipped away towards fine leg
another yorker, hit hard towards long-on which means Bravo would get only a single
a juicy full toss on the leg side, Bravo helps it on its away and gets a six to backward square leg
down the leg side and called a wide, the batsmen cross as well
slower one outside off, Pooran was looking to go big down the ground, loses his shape and fails to connect
length outside off, backs away and slaps it over extra cover, a couple of bounces and beats the man at long-off, coming in to cut it off
length ball, Pooran backs away and pulls it over square leg, this is turning out to be a big over
gets to his fifty with a reverse sweep, only off 24 balls. Takes it on the full and lofts it over the man at short third man
23 from that over. Another reverse sweep but this was pitched way outside leg. Pooran fetches it from there towards covers
length ball at the pads, whipped straight to square leg on the bounce
dropped short at a middle stump line. Pulls firmly to deep midwicket's left
and he goes square leg. Length ball drifts into the pad and Rohit has a free hit there, really. Not a big sweeper usually, but he's nonchalant as he swats this uppishly
short of a length just outside off, caressed to cover's left off the back foot
length on middle stump, right behind it to defend off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, sliced to extra cover with the turn
short of a length just outside off, stays leg side as he punches straight to cover point
off the toe end but all he needs to do is clear the infield. Short and wide outside off, opens his arms up and chops it uppishly over cover
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point
short of a length just outside off, inside edge into the point region as he looks to punch off the back foot
short of a length on leg  stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
slapped away. Dhawan with an early step back and across as Oshane goes chest-height with the short ball. He's in good position as he pulls well in front square to beat the fielder in the deep
length on leg stump, deflected to square leg with the angle

drilled straight to mid-off! Rohit upset with himself. This was a slower ball that he's picked and it's landing at a leg stump line and is overpitched. It's there for a pasting, but he's managed to go neither above mid-off, nor to his left. It's hit hard, but Brathwaite does well to hold a stable base and take it with the reverse cup
length at leg stump, walks down and jabs towards mid-on
another slower ball that isn't going to be known for its covertness. Nicely lobbed at middle stump and he slogs to find deep square at the fence
short ball slanted well down leg side. Rahul chucks his hands at it and manages to get something with his left hand. It's a backhand past short fine in the end
gorgeous. KL Rahul brings the grace early. Short of a length ball just outside off and he's managed to punch it on the up, off the front foot and between cover and extra
full on off stump, driven straight to mid-off

beats the infield and that's four more. Offcutter dropped short of a length. Dhawan runs down the pitch and forces the pace on this punch. There's a dive but he's managed to beat it. Once again, not great connection, but he's found the gap
short of a length at off stump, steps out and gets cramped. Drags it to mid-on
full outside off. Met as a full toss but he can't punch this past extra cover
slower short ball wide outside off, steps out and waits, and then adjusts to tap from under this and clear mid-off
shot. Dhawan picking his bowler, and picking his gaps. Down the pitch to meet this length ball in front of leg stump before clipping it over midwicket
full on leg stump, pushed towards long-on but he can't beat the bowler
nicely done. Full ball at middle stump, backs into the leg side and  uses his wrists to carve this over point with the turn
length at leg stump, gets to the pitch and drives straight to mid-on. He'd have wanted to place that better

sliced over extra cover. This is very short and very slow and he's almost moved too soon into the leg side. Reaching out in the end and has to generate a lot of strength from his core. But that is the advantage of the Powerplay. You only have to clear the field. This runs away
full on middle stump, drilled back to the bowler

massive turn. That's come out of nowhere! Short of a length and in at middle stump. Rahul looking to play it with the angle and turn it into the leg side. Is made to look like a tailender as it rips away. No way anyone was getting bat on that
full on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to deep square
short ball pushed well down leg side. Left alone

got him! Rahul wants to smoke this over mid-off, but he hasn't come close to the pitch of it. There's a small deviation away from a length outside off and that is enough. The head and the foot were well inside the line of the ball, the hands flailing far away
length at off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
full on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full again, onto the pads. Stays tall this time and delicately taps it past midwicket
short and wide outside off, swishes and misses
offcutter at a length on off stump, gets forward and flicks straight to midwicket
short ball at middle stump, pulled along the turf to deep square
offcutter again. Dropped short at leg stump, dragged to deep square with a pull
length on middle stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
offcutter dropped short and wide outside off. Stays tall and spanks it past extra cover, but sweeper cleans up to his left
slower ball at a length outside off. Wants to drive on the up but this skids through from under the blade
length on off stump, stabbed in front of point with soft hands
slower ball dropped short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length on off stump, sliced on the up to find point
length outside off, punched to long-off
yorker just outside off, jammed down to long-off
slower ball at off stump, steps out and mistimes a drive. It allows them to take a second in the end as it crawls between long-on and deep midwicket
attempted yorker outside off. Hurriedly tapped to extra cover
slower ball dropped short outside off. Stays still in the crease and pummels this over the bowler with a flat bat
beaten as he looks to plat a reverse ramp. It's a full toss just outside off. Can't make connection
yorker down leg side, can't get bat on it
yorker at leg stump, squeezed back down the pitch
nearly falls over as he keeps this yorker out. Splendid execution. Right at middle stump and giving him no chance to swing his bat
poor finish. Drops it short and outside leg stump. He stays under it and hooks over short fine leg
length outside off, sliced to sweeper's right
slower ball cutting away from a length outside off. Looks to shellack this over extra cover. Gets an outside edge and it lands short of the keeper
gets it past short third. Slower ball, length on off stump. Uses the spin away from him to reverse ramp
yorker length on off stump, dug out to long-off
slower ball lobbed up full outside off. Driven to long-off
beaten. Slower ball at a length just outside off. Heaves at it, full blooded, but is well beaten
short and just outside off. Backs away and cuts to sweeper's right
length at off stump, pokes it into the covers with soft hands
clears the square leg boundary! Not a lot of balance there, but he's made the required connection. That was climbing up at his waist and he swung hard from under it
drives straight into the stumps at the other end. Steps out at this length ball and meets it at the pitch for a nicely timed drive. Gets no runs, but there's respite - Oshane has overstepped.

swings it over deep midwicket. Oshane feeling the heat. It's a length ball at leg stump. He stays deep in the crease, clears the front leg and lets go of years of technique training as he slugs this like its gully cricket
length at off stump, tapped into the off side
length on leg stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short of a length at leg stump, gets deep in the crease and turns this to deep square
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length on leg stump, mistmed slog to deep midwicket
full and wide outside off, steps out and makes him reach a long way. He manages to jam it to long-off's right
length on middle stump, nudged to deep midwicket off the back foot and that is his fifty
one bounce and past long-off, to his left. This is a length ball on off and he clubs it on the up, straight over the non-striker
slower ball at a length outside off. Gets the slog off the inside half and it falls short of deep midwicket

beautifully done. Pollard jumps wide of the crease late in his run up to lend more angle to his awaycutter. Dhawan waits for it to land and goes with the angle. Slaps it off the front foot to the wide long-off boundary
slower ball lobbed up at off stump. He taps it with soft hands into the newly vacated extra cover region. It's his own doing. Allows him the second
offcutter at a length on off stump. Taps to deep extra
one-handed swipe over deep midwicket. Incredible. He's beaten by pace but he has enough in this swing to send it comfortably over. It's floated up full on off stump and he has a clean swing under it
length at leg stump, gets forward and turns it to short fine
length on middle stump, mistimed heave to deep midwicket
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square

he's a bona fide murderer of spin bowling. Particularly the harmless flighted ball that pitches outside leg stump. Merely walks at it and swings off the inside half to get this between deep square and deep midwicket
length ball outside off, looks for the reverse sweep and misses
flat and full outside off,  drilled straight to long-off
full and just outside off. Driven to long-on with a closed face
whipped between deep square and deep midwicket. Impeccable placement again. Overpitched and on the toes. He makes sure to swivel and place his exactly where he wants
slower ball at a length outside off. Mistimed drive after stepping out but once again long-on will have a hard time getting to that as a result and they'll get two
overpitched outside off, driven straight to extra cover
length outside off, steps out and drives straight to extra cover
full toss on leg stump, flicked uppishly between deep square and deep midwicket

falls short of Pierre and it bounces over the fine leg boundary. That's a good shot option. A length ball on leg and he just bends down and ramps this. It lobs high to Pierre's left and he sprints and lunges at it. Won't get there. That is a maiden fifty for Pant
yorker at leg stump, can't get bat on the attempted flick. Deflects into the leg side
drilled. Good shot. This is tossed up wide outside off. He steps out and chops it on the half-volley to clear long-off
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
length at middle, dragged to deep square with a mistimed slog
full at the toes, clipped to deep square
slower ball at off stump from around the wicket. Tapped to point's left off the front foot
slower ball at a length, wide outside off. Throws the bat at this but toe-ends it to extra cover
short and just outside off. Steps out and hurriedly swats at this. Just manages to clear point and it trckles gently into the boundary
yorker at off stump, tapped straight to extra cover

lofted over mid-off. Fully in control this time. Dhawan ending this battle with the upper hand. A full ball on off stump, he puts in a half-stride, offers the full face, and keeps poise as he picks up four more
full and wide outside off, driven on the bounce to extra cover
slips out of the hand and it ends up a full toss at stomach height. Pant looks to swing it over the boundary at square leg, but he's lost his bearings. It runs to fine leg's right
attempted yorker is a full toss down leg side. Looks to paddle this but can't connect
yorker at off stump. Clears the leg and swings for it, but he can only get it out to long-off
another full toss that he can't get a hold of. Drags it to deep midwicket's left with a slog off the inside half

oh that's harsh from the umpire. Pant walks down the pitch and skips away from this yorker headed for his heels. It goes by leg stump, where Pant was originally standing. Brathwaite not impressed with the wide call. He has a case.
length down leg side, follows the batsman who shovels this into the leg side
length at middle stump, runs it to short third man off the outside half
yorker just outside leg stump. Backs into the off side to try and heave behind square on the off side. Inside edge onto pad and a single at fine leg
yorker at the toes. Clipped along the floor to deep square
full and wide outside off, controlled drive to sweeper's left

smashes middle stump. Pant wants to open the face and ramp this through the gully region. Gets the front leg well out of the way and pokes at it with the face open. The physics just won't work on that. It's a yorker aimed in at middle stump from around the wicket. But it's been that kind of innings, and it has been rewarding for him.
yorker at middle stump, digs it out into the leg side
full at middle stump, clears the front leg and looks to drill it wide of long-on. Gets an inside edge onto pad
inswinging yorker at middle stump. Jams it to midwicket
yorker length at off stump, drilled firmly back at the bowler who parries it towards long-off. They get two to long-off's left

short and wide outside off, sliced to sweeper's right. Hetmyer sprints to his right and tumbles as he gets his right hand down at this. He loses balance and as he rolls over, his shoe inadvertently stops the ball from rolling into the rope.
short of a length at middle stump, pulled straight to deep midwicket
length at off stump, dipping sharply as he opens the face and slices this past point
straight to square leg. Length ball flat at a length, runs down the track and flicks straight to the fielder

clubs it straight to long-on! Oh dear! How has it come to this? Length ball lobbed up outside off. Steps out and pummels this, flat and straight to Pollard who is ten yards in from the rope. What an innings from Dhawan, but will this shot end up haunting him?

misfield from the bowler! And they run through! Oh Fabian Allen nearly had it. The best fielder in the West Indies side can't quite wrap his hands around this. Length ball at leg stump, Pandey taps gently towards mid-on and Allen does superbly to lunge and get across to his right. DK has long begun running and is halfway down the pitch as Allen gets a hand on it. But he only parries it past midwicket, who is running in towards him and therefore won't be around to cover. Allen is devastated, his team-mates console him.
